TopicTitle: What resolution do you play KSP at?

Articles.Content:
I'm curious as to what resolution people play KSP at. I myself play at 1280x1024 with a Dell 1707FP.

If your option is "Other", please let me know so you can be included in the data.

Feel free to move this thread to the right location if needed.

Edited August 27, 2015 by Mrsupersonic8
1024x768, aside from a handful of screenshots. I should check again to see if I can go lower rez without messing up UI elements...
I have 2200 x 1380 window on 2560x1440 screen. I can put other windows at edges and monitor other processes or use easily other programs.

I play in windowed mode in a custom resolution I set up with the nVidia control panel (KSP forgets the resolution if you edit the config file directly and then later adjust settings in the settings menu) - it's 1900x1000.

It lets me switch between KSP and other applications more easily than fullscreen, and the slight reduction in resolution makes it easier to center the window (+/- 20 pixels freedom on x and y axis; Windows stupidly tries to cascade it every time it starts up), and gives space for the taskbar at the bottom.

1920x1200

Surprised it wasn't in the options, it being so common.
1080p now. In the past I've played at 1280x1024 which was OK and 720p which felt cramped.
1920x1080 window on a 2560x1440 display on my desktop, and 1680x1050 fullscreen on my laptop.
1680x1050, Nvidia graphics card on a refurb Lenovo monitor.
1920x1080... 27" sony monitor.

3440x1440 @60

Makes for a pretty awesome cockpit view.
Other. My monitor is 2560x1600, but I run KSP in a window at 1920x1440, so that it makes a nice 4:3 window that fills most of the monitor height.

1080p. Had it higher but because of the textures, it didn't benefit the game at all and made UI too small. It really all just comes down to preference here. KSP isn't exactly a beautiful game compared to others out there.

Other: 2560x1080p

Used to play at 3440x1440p, but after rearranging my work space, my monitor is a little further away and I can't read text well enough at that resolution anymore.
Play windowed at 1920x1080 resolution on an 2560x1440 screen.

I actually have two setups: 1920x1080 full screen with no mods for when I'm designing & testing or just for fun. Then I use 1600X900 with the Astronomer's Visual pack in a windowed mode to do picture and video capture.

JR
1080p on my desktop, 1280 x 800 on my Macbook Pro.

Other. My monitor is 2560x1600, but I run KSP in a window at 1920x1440, so that it makes a nice 4:3 window that fills most of the monitor height.

Same idea here, but windowed into a 1280x800 - If I go any higher KSP crashes repeatedly - so a reasonable compromise.
1440x900! Got an ASUS VK192 monitor, had to buy a special HDMI-VGA adapter to use my native resolution... (GeForce 660GTX)
I think I play at 1080 or 1280 x 720. Monitor is 1366 x 768.

1920x1080 on my Radeon HD 5770 and the open-source Linux drivers.

It's playable.
1600x900 in a window on a 1920x1080 monitor.
